result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger C Bose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.
Restitution has been paid in full.

timeConds.notes: Stayed as long as Defendant is paying a minimum of $150 per month toward financial obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger C Bose

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roger C Bose in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, clarifies issue for Defendant. State advises of plea agreement. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Counts 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State requests that Court adopt sentencing as outlined on May 23. Court readopts sentence from May 23, backdates JOC to May 23, 2016.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Roger C Bose appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Hawley explains situation to Defendant, advises that he needs to be here in person for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Roger C Bose in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges. State advises of previous activity. Defendant advises that he couldn't pay the lawyer, wants to just pay the restitution and get it over with. State advises of plea agreement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Roger C Bose in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defendant retained James Foote, who could not be here today.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Roger C Bose in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on progress with DA. State advises of offer made to Defendant. Defendant wants to accept State's offer.  Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant decides to get an attorney.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
No contact direct or indirect with Birchwood Lodge, Open Hearth Lodge, Landmark Resort. Not to write any checks. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Roger C Bose in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Summons and Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
